Issues.Title: @angular/language-service doesn't suport pipes with overloaded transform method
Issues.Body:
# 🚀 feature request ### Relevant Package This feature request is for `@angular/language-service` ### Description Currently, pipes that contain overloaded transform methods, are not accepted by the language service. For example, this simple pipe with two method signatures will have 2 distinct errors with valid use cases: ``` @Pipe({ name: 'translate', }) export class TranslatePipe implements PipeTransform { transform(value: string, namespace?: string): string; transform(value: string, params?: string | Record, namespace?: string): string { console.log('transforming...'); } } ``` The first error is: ``` Argument type Record is not assignable to parameter type string | undefined ``` When using the pipe like this: ```

{{ 'with.params' | translate:stringParams }}

``` And the 2nd error is: ``` Invalid number of arguments, expected 1..2 ``` When using the pipe like this: ```

{{ 'with.params.and.namespace' | translate:stringParams:featureNamespace }}

``` Judging by the errors, the language service takes into account only the first method signature. To reproduce this, you can run `ng serve` in this example Angular v10 repository: > https://github.com/SchnWalter/ng-pipe-method-overloading-issue And check the browser to see that everything is working with a single method signature, then uncomment the 2nd one and you will see that the application compiles successfully after the change and it still works properly, but now both the IDE and Angular Compiler will show the 2 type of errors that I've listed above. This is the log output with a comment inserted where the 2nd signature was un-commented. ``` > ng serve chunk {main} main.js, main.js.map (main) 14.5 kB [initial] [rendered] chunk {polyfills} polyfills.js, polyfills.js.map (polyfills) 141 kB [initial] [rendered] chunk {runtime} runtime.js, runtime.js.map (runtime) 6.15 kB [entry] [rendered] chunk {styles} styles.js, styles.js.map (styles) 12.4 kB [initial] [rendered] chunk {vendor} vendor.js, vendor.js.map (vendor) 2.72 MB [initial] [rendered] Date: 2020-05-06T23:28:28.055Z - Hash: 1758942286bf1bc9d64f - Time: 5877ms ** Angular Live Development Server is listening on localhost:4200, open your browser on http://localhost:4200/ ** : Compiled successfully. ///// UN-COMMENT METHOD SIGNATURE... Date: 2020-05-06T23:28:37.928Z - Hash: a3489c657d7e6a14600e 4 unchanged chunks chunk {main} main.js, main.js.map (main) 14.3 kB [initial] [rendered] Time: 227ms : Compiled successfully. ERROR in src/app/app.component.ts:8:37 - error TS2345: Argument of type 'Record' is not assignable to parameter of type 'string'. 8

{{ 'with.params' | translate:stringParams }}

~~~~~~~~~~~~ src/app/app.component.ts:9:67 - error TS2554: Expected 1-2 arguments, but got 3. 9

{{ 'with.namespace.undefined.params' | translate:undefined:appOneNamespace }}

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ src/app/app.component.ts:11:64 - error TS2554: Expected 1-2 arguments, but got 3. 11

{{ 'with.params.and.namespace' | translate:stringParams:appOneNamespace }}

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ ``` ### Describe alternatives you've considered TypeScript method overloading is a "nice to have" feature, but it's not a deal breaker.

Issues.Title: feat(bazel): simplify ng_package by dropping esm5 and fesm5
Issues.Body:
esm5 and fesm5 are no longer needed and have been deprecated in the past.

https://v9.angular.io/guide/deprecations#esm5-and-fesm5-code-formats-in-angular-npm-packages

This commit modifies ng_package to no longer distribute these two formats in npm packages
built by ng_package (e.g. @angular/core).

This commit intentionally doesn't fully clean up the ng_package rule to remove all traces of esm5 and fems5
build artifacts as that is a bigger cleanup and currently we are narrowing down the scope of this change
to the MVP needed for v10, which in this case is 'do not put esm5 and fesm5' into the npm packages.

More cleanup to follow: https://angular-team.atlassian.net/browse/FW-2143

and taking the mouse movement direction change into account in a way that is not always correct.

Issues.Title: bug([<mat-select>]): form is submitted even if mat-select is not selected, required does not work
Issues.Body:
Hi, my problem is quite simple, Angular Material's **native select** `required` works fine:
```
<mat-form-field>
    <mat-label>Project</mat-label>
    <select matNativeControl formControlName="projectName" (change)="onChangeProjectName($event.target.value)" required>
        <option *ngFor="let project of userProjects" [value]="project.id">{{project.id}}</option>
    </select>
</mat-form-field>
```

**BUT** the `<mat-select>` version **submits the form even if the field is not selected**. The `required` is not respected:
```
<mat-form-field>
    <mat-label>Project</mat-label>
    <mat-select formControlName="projectName" (change)="onChangeProjectName($event.target.value)" required>
        <mat-option *ngFor="let project of userProjects" [value]="project.id">{{project.id}}</mat-option>
    </mat-select>
</mat-form-field>
```
This code is really similar to Angular Material's native version, but I use `<mat-select>` and `<mat-option>`, and I have removed `matNativeControl`.

As you can see I don't have problem with Angular Material's native version, just have a problem with the `<mat-select>` version. I didn't put the whole form but I use : 
* `(ngSubmit)` on `<form>` for submitting the form
* `ngNativeValidate` on `<form>` for validation (because it's way nicer than using `Validators.required`)
* `[formGroup]` on `<form>` and `formControlName` on fields (because it's looks way nicer than using `[formControl]="myFormName.controls.myFieldName"` on each form field).


#### Environment

- Angular: 9.1.4
- CDK/Material: 9.2.2
- Browser(s): Chrome 80
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Ubuntu

Issues.Title: fix(drag-drop): Double executing auto-scroll logic and not resetting …
Issues.Body:
…auto-scroll properties.

An RxJS bug is currently causing the `interval(0, animationFrameScheduler)` auto-scroll logic to be executed twice as often as it should be.

This commit changes from using the RxJS `interval` to a traditional `requestAnimationFrame` loop. When auto-scrolling is triggered to stop, `cancelAnimationFrame` is called with the request ID returned from `requestAnimationFrame` call. Fall back to `setTimeout` if `requestAnimationFrame` is not available.

The `AUTO_SCROLL_STEP` constant is changed from 2 to 4 to keep the same "feel" as before. 

This commit also resets the drop list auto-scroll properties when auto-scroll is stopped. This fixes a bug where auto-scrolling into a list and dropping an item can break auto-scrolling when executing the same sequence of events again.

Fixes [#19241](https://github.com/angular/components/issues/19241) and [#19242](https://github.com/angular/components/issues/19242).
